Package eu.acclimatize.unison.location

Class LocationService

java.lang.Object
eu.acclimatize.unison.location.LocationService
@Service public class LocationService extends Object
A service that is used to find, to replace, and to delete locations.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    LocationService(LocationRepository locationRepository, HourlyPrecipitationRepository hpr, HourlyWeatherRepository hwr, org.springframework.data.domain.Sort sort)
    Creates an instance of LocationSerivce.

  • Constructor Details

    • LocationService

      public LocationService(LocationRepository locationRepository, HourlyPrecipitationRepository hpr, HourlyWeatherRepository hwr, org.springframework.data.domain.Sort sort)
      Creates an instance of LocationSerivce.
      Parameters:
      locationRepository - The repository where locations are stored.
      hpr - The repository where precipitation data is stored.
      hwr - The repository where weather data is stored.
      sort - Determines the order in which locations with be ordered when finding all stored locations.

  • Method Details

    • delete

      @PreAuthorize("#ownedItem.hasOwner(authentication.name)") public void delete(Location ownedItem)
      Delete a location and associated harvested data if the authenticated user added the location.
      Parameters:
      ownedItem - The location to be deleted.

    • replace

      @PreAuthorize("#current.hasOwner(authentication.name) and #updated.hasOwner(authentication.name)") public void replace(Location current, Location updated)
      Replaces the current location with the updated location. Only the user that added the location can update it.
      Parameters:
      current - The location stored in the repository.
      updated - The new location with the same name.

    • findAllSorted

      public Iterable<Location> findAllSorted()
      Finds all locations in a sorted order.
      Returns:
      The locations found.

    • find

      public Location find(String locationName)
      Finds a specific location. If a location of the specified name is not present a location not found exception will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      locationName - The name of the location to find.
      Returns:
      The location found.
